notes.text: When ever is used as an intensifier after how, what, when, where, or why, it should be separated by a space. Thus, how ever did you find her? could be rephrased, with no change of meaning, how did you ever find her? This rule tends to be more often followed—or more widely understood—in Britain than in the US. However in the sense of ‘no matter how’ (however gently you correct him, Peter always takes offense) should be spelled as one word. See also whatever

definitions: used to introduce a statement that contrasts with or seems to contradict something that has been said previously

examples.text: People tend to put on weight in middle age. However, gaining weight is not inevitable

shortDefinitions: used to introduce statement that contrasts with or seems to contradict something that has been said previously

definitions: in whatever way; regardless of how

examples.text: however you look at it, you can't criticize that
he was hesitant to take the risk, however small
